Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that the applicant is not a Convention refugee or person in need of protection under Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Governing_Law: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: Applicant feared recruitment by FARC and claimed insufficient state protection in Colombia; inconsistencies in applicant's testimony; father's testimony deemed unreliable
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, quashing of Board's decision, and reconsideration
Court_Ruling: Application allowed; decision quashed; remanded for reconsideration by a different Board member
Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking refugee status in Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution due to risk of FARC recruitment and lack of state protection in Colombia
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution or risk to life due to inability to access state protection
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant and witness testimony, availability of state protection in Colombia
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under Section 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Credibility_Assessment: Board found inconsistencies in applicant’s testimony and deemed father’s testimony unreliable
Evidence_Used: Applicant's testimony, father's testimony, evidence on state protection in Colombia
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 96, 97, and 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Claim of being a Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Evidence_Assessed: Testimonial evidence from applicant and family, country condition evidence regarding Colombia
Relief_Sought: Recognition as Convention refugee or person in need of protection, stay in Canada
Governing_Rule: Individual must demonstrate well-founded fear of persecution or risk to life due to inability to access state protection under IRPA
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of reliable supporting evidence
Outcome: Court allowed application, quashed decision, ordered reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced recruitment by FARC if returned to Colombia
Cause_Description: Applicant feared recruitment by FARC and claimed Colombia could not provide adequate protection
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and reliability of testimonies and country information
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; issue was misapplication of Sections 96 and 97
Evidence_Issues: Unreliable witness testimony, inconsistent applicant statements
Legal_Provision: Sections 96, 97, and 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Testimonies assessed for consistency and plausibility; country conditions considered
Decision_Rationale: Board's credibility assessment and state protection analysis were unreasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility gaps and reliability concerns in presented testimony
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution and inability to access state protection
